readme:
# ion-toast

A Toast is a subtle notification commonly used in modern applications. It can be used to provide feedback about an operation or to display a system message. The toast appears on top of the app's content, and can be dismissed by the app to resume user interaction with the app.

### Creating

All of the toast options should be passed in the create method. The message to display should be passed in the `message` property. The `showCloseButton` option can be set to true in order to display a close button on the toast. See the properties below for all available options.

### Positioning

Toasts can be positioned at the top, bottom or middle of the viewport. The position can be passed upon creation. The possible values are `top`, `bottom` and `middle`. If the position is not specified, the toast will be displayed at the bottom of the viewport.

### Dismissing

The toast can be dismissed automatically after a specific amount of time by passing the number of milliseconds to display it in the `duration` of the toast options. If `showCloseButton` is set to true, then the close button will dismiss the toast. To dismiss the toast after creation, call the `dismiss()` method on the instance.
docs: A Toast is a subtle notification commonly used in modern applications. It can be used to provide feedback about an operation or to display a system message. The toast appears on top of the app's content, and can be dismissed by the app to resume user interaction with the app.

props.name: buttons
props.docs: An array of buttons for the toast.

props.name: closeButtonText
props.docs: Text to display in the close button.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: cssClass
props.docs:
Additional classes to apply for custom CSS. If multiple classes are
provided they should be separated by spaces.

props.name: duration
props.docs:
How many milliseconds to wait before hiding the toast. By default, it will show
until `dismiss()` is called.

props.name: enterAnimation
props.type: ((Animation: Animation, baseEl: any, opts?: any) => Promise<Animation>) | undefined
props.docs: Animation to use when the toast is presented.

props.name: header
props.docs: Header to be shown in the toast.

props.name: keyboardClose
props.docs: If `true`, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

props.name: leaveAnimation
props.type: ((Animation: Animation, baseEl: any, opts?: any) => Promise<Animation>) | undefined
props.docs: Animation to use when the toast is dismissed.

props.name: message
props.docs: Message to be shown in the toast.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: position
props.docs: The position of the toast on the screen.

props.name: showCloseButton
props.docs: If `true`, the close button will be displayed.

props.name: translucent
props.docs: If `true`, the toast will be translucent.

methods.name: dismiss
methods.signature: dismiss(data?: any, role?: string | undefined) => Promise<boolean>

parameters.name: data
parameters.docs: Any data to emit in the dismiss events.

parameters.name: role
parameters.docs:
The role of the element that is dismissing the toast.
This can be useful in a button handler for determining which button was
clicked to dismiss the toast.
Some examples include: ``"cancel"`, `"destructive"`, "selected"`, and `"backdrop"`.

methods.docs: Dismiss the toast overlay after it has been presented.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: data Any data to emit in the dismiss events.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text:
role The role of the element that is dismissing the toast.
This can be useful in a button handler for determining which button was
clicked to dismiss the toast.
Some examples include: ``"cancel"`, `"destructive"`, "selected"`, and `"backdrop"`.

methods.name: onDidDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the toast did dismiss.

methods.name: onWillDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the toast will dismiss.

methods.name: present
methods.docs: Present the toast overlay after it has been created.

events.docs: Emitted after the toast has dismissed.
Emitted after the toast has presented.
Emitted before the toast has dismissed.
Emitted before the toast has presented.
